title: Zrazy Zawijane (Polish Beef Rolls)
description: Tender beef slices stuffed with bacon, pickles, and vegetables, simmered in a rich gravy with mushrooms - a classic Polish comfort dish.

ingredients.item: Beef top round or sirloin, sliced thin

instructions: Pound beef slices between plastic wrap until very thin (about 1/4 inch). Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Spread about 1 tsp mustard on each beef slice. Place one bacon slice, one pickle, some grated carrot and chopped onion on each.
Roll up tightly and secure with toothpicks or tie with kitchen twine. Dredge rolls in flour, shaking off excess.
Heat oil and butter in large Dutch oven. Brown zrazy on all sides, about 8-10 minutes total. Remove and set aside.
In same pot, add mushrooms and remaining onion. Cook until softened, about 8 minutes.
Sprinkle with 2 tbsp flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add red wine, scraping up browned bits.
Add beef broth, bay leaves, allspice, and peppercorns. Return zrazy to pot, bring to simmer.
Cover and simmer on low heat for 2-2.5 hours until beef is very tender, turning occasionally.
Remove zrazy to platter. Strain sauce if desired, or leave mushrooms in. Adjust seasoning.
If sauce is too thin, mix 2 tbsp flour with 4 tbsp water, whisk into sauce and simmer until thickened.
Remove toothpicks/string, return zrazy to sauce to warm through. Garnish with parsley.
Serve with mashed potatoes, boiled potatoes, or kasza (buckwheat).
